de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator

Class AbstractDialogDecorator<DialogType extends Dialog>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.AbstractDialogDecorator<DialogType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dialog
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonBarDialogDecorator, HeaderDialogDecorator, ListDialogDecorator, MaterialDialogDecorator, ProgressDialogDecorator, ValidateableDialogDecorator

    public abstract class AbstractDialogDecorator<DialogType extends Dialog>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Dialog
    An abstract base class for all decorators, which allow to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractDialogDecorator(DialogType dialog)
      Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void attach(View view)
      Attaches the decorator to the view hierarchy.
      void detach()
      Detaches the decorator from the view hierarchy.
      Context getContext()
      Returns the context, which is used by the dialog.
      protected DialogType getDialog()
      Returns the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator.
      protected View getView()
      Returns the root view of the view hierarchy, which is modified by the decorator.
      protected abstract void onAttach(View view)
      The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is attached to the view hierarchy.
      protected abstract void onDetach()
      The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is detached from the view hierarchy.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDialogDecorator

        public AbstractDialogDecorator(@NonNull
                               DialogType dialog)
        Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog, whose view hierarchy should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the generic type DialogType. The dialog may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • onAttach

        protected abstract void onAttach(@NonNull
                                 View view)
        The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is attached to the view hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the dialog, which is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • onDetach

        protected abstract void onDetach()
        The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is detached from the view hierarchy.

      • getDialog

        @NonNull
protected final DialogType getDialog()
        Returns the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator.
        Returns:
        The dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the generic type DialogType. The dialog may not be null

      • getView

        @Nullable
protected final View getView()
        Returns the root view of the view hierarchy, which is modified by the decorator.
        Returns:
        The root view of the view hierarchy, which is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View or null, if the decorator is not attached

      • getContext

        public final Context getContext()
        Description copied from interface: Dialog
        Returns the context, which is used by the dialog.
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface Dialog
        Returns:
        The context, which is used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context

      • attach

        public final void attach(@NonNull
                         View view)
        Attaches the decorator to the view hierarchy. This enables the decorator to modify the view hierarchy until it is detached.
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • detach

        public final void detach()
        Detaches the decorator from the view hierarchy. This prevents the decorator from modifying the view hierarchy until it is attached again.
